channel.title: Xbox taking over?
channel.description:
I'm watching G4, and Xbox360 has pretty much slapped any other console across the face, and stole all its dignity. They have pretty much claimed all of playstations best games, I believe Devil May Cry was one of the best if not the best, and its going to Xbox360 now, not to mention all of the games coming out within next summer. Do you think Xbox360 even has competition anymore? I think they said they have sold about 7million Xbox360's since last year(holy shit..) What do you think about it.
Before you post, don't come in here saying how much you like playstation or xbox360, tell me what you actually think about whats going on.

item.description:

[/quote]

FF13…looks AMAZING.

[quote author=exe626 link=topic=171560.msg1588007#msg1588007 date=1184209597]

Lol. Exe, you’re protecting yourself from the truth.

Lies.

I don’t even know what that is, stop spamming.
[/quote]I’m not spamming, I’m pointing out your refusal to even absorb a single positive thing about the PS3.

I know the ups and downs of the Ps3, but giving it 60-80g isn’t really necessary. There is no way any game would require that with current technology. Halo, possibly the most massive game released yet doesn’t require that. Show me why it needs that much, and I’ll listen.

Downloading films and full games.[/quote]

Yes, I saw a video of the pre-beta release about a year ago. Fucking awesome

item.title: Xbox taking over?
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

For a 500-hour long RPG, of course. And Halo 3, the most massive game yet? Assuming it’s like the other Halos, it’s tiny. The campaign on Halo 1 and 2 can be done in ~2 days with several long breaks. With a BluRay disc, there is practically no limit on models, game length, etc. According to what’s been said above, MGS4 does require that space. That space may not be absolutely necessary, but it’s there and there’s really no reason not to have it.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox taking over?
item.dc:creator: @Taios Taios
item.description:
@Taios wrote:

[quote=“Bang Train, post:27, topic:121958”][quote author=Taios link=topic=171560.msg1587206#msg1587206 date=1184189436]

I’m watching G4, and Xbox360 has pretty much slapped any other console across the face, and stole all its dignity. They have pretty much claimed all of playstations best games, I believe Devil May Cry was one of the best if not the best, and its going to Xbox360 now, not to mention all of the games coming out within next summer. Do you think Xbox360 even has competition anymore? I think they said they have sold about 7million Xbox360’s since last year(holy shit…) What do you think about it.

Before you post, don’t come in here saying how much you like playstation or xbox360, tell me what you actually think about whats going on.

SLow and steady wins the race.

PS3 is built like a brick, 1% of them break, it is jammed pack with expensive amazing hardware that stops certain games being available on the 360. (For example MGS4 and Killzone2 both take up mass amounts of space. MG4 takes up something like 25GB already. This will only fit on the ps3 blue ray disks and is impossible to fit on a 360;s disks. If it were to go onto the 360 it would be like a 12 disk box set. The same with kill zone 2)

The 360 was rushed out and lacks a lot of quality. 33% of them break.

The 360 atm is only winning on their live system, games and price.

When the ps3 gets further updated (which, each update is pretty good), more games come out, and the price eventually further drops.

The only thing the 360 will have is a few exclusive games.

The ps3 has some WICKED brank spanking new exclusives comming out. DMC is getting boring.

Killzone 2 looks amazing and heavenly sword like WOW.

If Microsoft want to be able to beat the ps3 in the future its going to have to update all its hardware. 360 ownerswill have to keep buying updated systems.

The ps3 brought out a new 80GB system. Does it matter to us 60GB owners? Hell no. You can go buy space and upgrade your ps3 YOURSELF. It takes about 5 mins and you can have a ps3 with 160GB HD. (which i intend to do).

Now the ps3 has stopped loosing money on each console it sells however the 360 has not.

In addition to that microsoft are having to sell over 1 billion inrepars because they rushed their console out.

Many are even on their 3rd 360 having 2 already broken. (something like 4% of people).

SO yes, the 360 is taking over for now. But slow and steady wins the race. The ps3 will take over in the future ;). (Over the 360 anyway, idk about the wii)

Might i also add, since getting my ps3 a month ago i’ve been a very active member at gaming communities such as gamespot. Frequently i see posts now saying ‘I absolutley hated sony, would never buy their console. However after my 360 broke the 2nd time, i have up and brought it. I now regret everything i ever said against sony’.

:).
[/quote]
MGS4 is no longer exclusive, they couldnt make the money back for the costs, so its now 360 too

so ive heard, I havent looked into it yet.

the E3 conference for nintedo just ended
* The Wii Zapper! Kinda like the NES lightgun, but more awesome, the zapper will be for use with Resident Evil Umbrella Chronicles, Sega’s Ghost Squad, Medal of Honor and no doubt every other shooter. The Zapper will be packaged with games, and costs $19.99.
* Super Smash Bros. Brawl hits shelves on Dec. 3rd. It can’t come fast enough!
* Legend of Zelda: Phantom Hourglass for the DS got a little love with a demo of the all-touch interface.
* Check Mii Out: A new channel where you send in your Miis to be evaluated and voted upon by others.
* Online Advances: Nintendo’s consoles have never been top dog when it comes to online, but the following online Wii titles might change that: Mario Strikers Charged, Madden NFL 08 and FIFA 08 will soon be online.
* Mario Kart on Wii, also online, drops early in 2008.
* Steering Wheel: Comes with Mario Kart.
* Brain Age 2 is out in the US on August 20.
* Super Mario Galaxy drops November 12th.
* The Nintendo Fat Mat was shown. Okay, it’s not called the Fat Mat, but we think it should be. It’s actually called a Wii balance board. The wireless, weight-sensitive mat comes with Wii Fit, a fitness trainer game, and will appeal to your girlfriend. You might think you’re too hardcore for it, but imagine the possibilities of a balance and weight sensitive mat combines with SSX Tricky or a Tony Hawk game. See what we’re saying?

Yoga anyone?[/quote]

Because you just said MGS4 is not exclusive means i cba to read the rest of your post.
Edit : read some. Wii is good. :). But im talking PS3 vs 360 :). Powerwise ps3 wins all. But like fancy omg wise. Wii wins all :). And its more fun really. but theres not really that many online games =(

In sony’s conference today, the MG4 creator says it is a ps3 exclusive. Also it wont fit on the 360.

exe626:

Your saying the same thing as the people of Gamespot. Blu-Ray is not that big, it just requires it to be more expensive, your still not showing me hard proof of its superiority.

Blue ray means you can turn a dvd into a hvd. So instead of storing 5gb of date. It can store like 20, or when in dual layer, it can store 50GB.

It gives more space for graphics optimisation and other nifty things. The whole idea is ‘you will never run out of space again’, but i can see with games improving, you will still get a 1-2 disk game or w/e

Read full topic
